page.title: 05Woodhead and Highfield Farms
page.content:
We interviewed Mr.Mosley at {Woodhead {Farm.}The farm land is mostly silage and rough grazing. The farm has a milking machine in an abreast milking parlour. It milks three cows at a time.The cows are automatically fed by a machine that lets nuts drop from a loft above.These nuts cost one penny each. Cows are fed individual amounts.
Mr.Mosley's dad had to do the work by hand. He had four horses for pulling different machines. Mr.Mosley likes driving the tractor in the fields. Tractors must have a protective cab and are quiet enough now to have a radio.
At{Highfield Farm}they have computer- worked collars round the cows' necks to tell how much food they need and show the amount of milk given.
